Question_1.Context: Osteoarthritis (OA) is a common degenerative articular disorder. In the study, the efficacy of Col II solution was compared with hyaluronic acid (HA) in a post-traumatic osteoarthritis (PTOA) model induced by surgical medial meniscectomy (MNX).
Question_1.Question: What was the observed effect of intra-articular administration of Col II solution on OA progression?
Question_1.Source: Dose-dependent attenuation of the OA progression was observed in the intra-articular administration of Col II solution, which significantly decreased the MNX-induced OA symptoms similar to HA.

Question_2.Context: The study evaluated the impact of Col II solution and HA on pain behavior in the MNX-induced OA rat model.
Question_2.Question: How did the weight distribution on the MNX-operated leg change in the Col II solution-treated groups compared to the OA group?
Question_2.Source: The weight-bearing of the MNX-induced leg in the Col II solution-treated groups was significantly increased compared to the OA group.

Question_3.Context: Micro-CT examination was used to assess the architectural integrity of the knee joint in the study.
Question_3.Question: What was the observed effect of Col II solution on bone volume in the MNX-induced OA model?
Question_3.Source: Col II solution treatment attenuated bone volume loss, indicating its role in cartilage preservation and preventing modifications in the subchondral bone.

Question_4.Context: Histological scoring was performed to assess cartilage repair in the rat knee joints.
Question_4.Question: What was the effect of Col II solution on the histological score in the MNX-induced OA model?
Question_4.D: Complete disruption of the new surface
Question_4.Source: The histological scores in the Col II solution-treated groups were significantly increased compared with the OA group, indicating improved cartilage repair.

Question_5.Context: The study evaluated the expression of type II collagen in chondrocytes in response to Col II solution and HA treatment.
Question_5.Question: What was the observed effect of Col II solution on type II collagen expression in chondrocytes?
Question_5.B: No change in type II collagen expression
Question_5.D: Complete disruption of type II collagen
Question_5.Source: Col II solution treatment significantly increased the expression of type II collagen in chondrocytes, indicating its role in cartilage regeneration.

Question_6.Context: The study assessed the expression of aggrecan around chondrocytes in response to Col II solution and HA treatment.
Question_6.Question: What was the effect of Col II solution on aggrecan expression around chondrocytes?
Question_6.Source: Col II solution treatment significantly elevated the aggrecan expression around chondrocytes, indicating its role in cartilage regeneration.

Question_7.Context: The study evaluated the expression of SOX-9 in chondrocytes in response to Col II solution and HA treatment.
Question_7.Question: What was the observed effect of Col II solution on SOX-9 expression in chondrocytes?
Question_7.Source: Col II solution treatment significantly increased the SOX-9 expression in chondrocytes, indicating its role in cartilage regeneration.

Question_8.Context: The study compared the therapeutic efficacy of Col II solution and HA in a post-traumatic osteoarthritis (PTOA) model induced by surgical medial meniscectomy (MNX).
Question_8.Question: What was the observed effect of Col II solution on body weight changes at the end of the experimental period?
Question_8.Source: No significant difference was found in body weight changes between the experimental groups at 6 weeks after treatments.

Question_9.Context: The study examined the impact of Col II solution and HA on pain behavior in the MNX-induced OA rat model.
Question_9.Question: What was the observed effect of Col II solution on pain behavior in the MNX-induced OA model?
Question_9.Source: The pain of the OA group was attenuated dose-dependently by Col II solution, similar to HA.

Question_10.Context: The study assessed the architectural integrity of the knee joint using Micro-CT examination in the MNX-induced OA model.
Question_10.Question: What was the observed effect of Col II solution on cartilage and bone damage in the MNX-induced OA model?
Question_10.Source: Col II solution treatment attenuated cartilage damage in the knee, similar to HA treatment.
